intro: Stirlingia anethifolia, commonly known as the anise-leaved flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, aromatic leaves that resemble anise in scent. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Stirlingia anethifolia is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks.
